												I felt compelled to write some sort of review of my own, after having read some of the posted reviews concerning this product. To be perfectly honest, it is definitely not worth the full sale price of $9.99 -- I bought it for $0.99 and I feel like, for that kind of price, it definitely was worth it. I could see the developers realistically charging maybe something like $3.00.In terms of gameplay, if you love "ragdoll-physics" games, then this could be worth adding to your collection but I wouldn't expect anything near the level of "depth" when compared to the very popular Goat Simulator, etc.The bikes are extremely hard to control. Typically, your rider has a very hard time just staying on his bike, let alone clearing jumps and collecting "peace points". However, this level of difficulty does not/did not leave me feeling frustrated or potentially enraged. Due to the simplicity of your objectives -- clearing rubble throughout town (simply by staying on the bike for as long as you possibly can) collecting peace points, and hitting ramps/speed-boosts -- it's actually, at least for me, incredibly relaxing. The game simply doesn't expect very much from you. Surgeon Simulator, on the other hand, frustrated me a lot faster, to the point that I simply stopped playing/lost interest (I'll just stick with Trauma Center).Eventually, controlling some of the bikes gets easier and some of the riders are better for maintaining a good grip on your bike (example: Ninja), allowing you to hit those jumps, etc.I feel like it's a funny game, as most "ragdoll-physics" games usually are. I don't get people that would bother, after having surveyed all the rest of the content on the internet on a daily basis, being "offended" by the extreme vagary of plot in this game.

Earning points gets you the ability to purchase boxes, in which you might get better gear. Getting better vehicles and riders you can make the game very easy for yourself. The last vehicle listed actually has the best handling and helps you get some achievements (the thing dropped randomly for me).So basically you have to work your way up from uneasy to easy controls by obtaining a better vehicle.
